data.fullContent: Progress in bronze casting made it possible for the Greeks to create large works, such as the Colossus of Rhodes, with a height of 32 meters. Many of the large bronze statues were lost - with the majority being melted to recover the material. Because of this, only the smaller objects still exist. Fortunately, during Hellenistic Greece, the raw materials were plentiful following eastern conquests.
data.answer: 青铜铸造的进步使希腊人有可能创造出巨大的作品，比如高32米的罗得岛巨像。许多大型青铜雕像都消失了——大部分都被融化以恢复原有的材料。因此，只有较小的物体仍然存在。幸运的是，在希腊化时期，东方征服之后，原材料充足。
